revised_title: Nuclear Forces and the Ground State of Oxygen 16: A Study of Binding Energies
tldr: This article explores the binding energies of atomic nuclei, focusing on nuclear forces and the ground state of oxygen 16. The authors apply Brueckner theory to finite nuclei, considering six different internucleon potentials with varying hard core radii. They analyze the effects of energy level self-consistency and pair correlations on the potential energy and discuss the importance of the hard core radius in determining nuclear saturation.
